item.title: Russia and Greece say spat over diplomats expulsions is over - The Associated Press
item.description:
Russia and Greece say spat over diplomats expulsions is over  The Associated Press

MOSCOW (AP) ‚Äî Russia and Greece have overcome a rift over the expulsions of diplomats that strained their traditionally friendly ties, the countries' leaders said Friday. Greece in July expelled two Russian diplomats amid allegations they helped fund protests against a deal between Greece and its northern neighbor Macedonia intended to pave the way for Macedonia to join NATO. Russia angrily rejected the claim and responded in kind, expelling two Greek diplomats in August. Russian President Vladimir Putin said after Friday's talks with Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras in the Kremlin that ...

item.title: Kremlin on collision course with Russian youth over concert bans and censorship - The Independent
item.description:
Kremlin on collision course with Russian youth over concert bans and censorship  The Independent

The problems started about a month ago, says Nikolai Kostylev, one half of the electronic duet IC3PEAK. The group would be headed for a concert, only for venue managers to cancel at last minute, citing threatening phone calls. There would be bomb scares; unannounced fire inspections; unexplained electricity failures; sudden urges to redecorate concert halls. There would even be arrests on arriving into town. ‚ÄúIt's all very unpleasant and terrorising,‚Äù Kostylev tells The Independent. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre doing nothing illegal, just singing our harmless, ironic songs. But we've found ourselves subject to a...

item.title: US loses to Russia in case of 2 arms trafficking suspects - The Associated Press
item.description:

But then the case took an unexpected turn. Instead of being extradited to the U.S., Vladimir Lyubishin Jr. and Sr. were sent back to Russia, where, the State Department says, it's not clear if they will face trial. "The United States believes that all the relevant factors favored extradition to the United States," the Justice Department to...

After he was photographed wearing the luxury timepiece at his extravagant August 2015 wedding, anti-corruption crusader Aleksei Navalny posted the photo on his website, which has thousands of Russian viewers daily, and pointed out that the price of the watch was four times Peskov's annual government salary. Russian President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman exchange high-fives at the G20 Leaders‚Äô Summit in Buenos Aires, on November 30, 2018. item.title: Menendez says U.S. sanctions on Russia's Deripaska should remain - Reuters
item.description:

The top Democrat on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on Wednesday urged the Trump administration not to waive or remove sanctions on Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska or two companies he controls. In a letter to U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin, Senator Bob Menendez cited unspecified reports that Treasury was considering such a move and noted the department's own analysis says the oligarch is accused of crimes from blackmail to murder. "I see no reason to remove sanctions against Mr. Deripaska, and until he divests from and relinquishes control of Rusal and EN+, there is no justifi...

item.title: British companies owned by Russian oligarchs to be investigated by US congress to examine links to intelligence agencies - The Telegraph
item.description:
British companies owned by Russian oligarchs to be investigated by US congress to examine links to intelligence agencies  The Telegraph

US congressional investigators have launched an inquiry into possible links between British-based companies owned by Russian oligarchs and their relationship with Russia‚Äôs intelligence agencies. The move follows increasing concerns by U.S. congressmen over the extent of Russian meddling in both the U.S. and Europe, with a number of oligarchs with close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin forming the main focus of the inquiry. Among the UK-based companies that have aroused the interest of congressional investigators is EN+, the energy company owned by Oleg Deripaska and chaired by Tory ...

item.title: Michael Cohen: Donald Trump's former fixer whose loyalty melted away under legal heat - The Telegraph
item.description:
Michael Cohen: Donald Trump's former fixer whose loyalty melted away under legal heat  The Telegraph

For a decade, Michael Cohen served as Donald Trump's lawyer and fixer, famously saying he would "take a bullet" for the president. His job was simple: to clean up any problems the business man- turned-presidential candidate ran into. Now Cohen, who pleaded guilty to eight charges relating to unpaid tax and campaign finances, has become Mr Trump's greatest threat. From publicly boasting of his loyalty to the US president, Cohen co-operated with the investigation into possible Russian collusion in the 2016 election. Having tied the last decade of his career personally to Mr Trump, it was an a...

item.title: Prosecutors call for ‚Äòsubstantial‚Äô prison term for Michael Cohen - Financial Times
item.description:
Prosecutors call for ‚Äòsubstantial‚Äô prison term for Michael Cohen  Financial Times

Prosecutors called on Friday for ‚Äúa substantial term of imprisonment‚Äù for Michael Cohen even as they acknowledged the one-time personal lawyer to Donald Trump had provided ‚Äúuseful‚Äù assistance to Robert Mueller‚Äôs investigation into Russia meddling in the 2016 election. In a court filing, the US attorney for the Southern District of New York detailed a litany of crimes and deceptions committed by Mr Cohen and suggested only a ‚Äúmodest‚Äù departure from federal guidelines that call for a sentence of 51 to 63 months. The sentencing recommendation was one of a series of highly anticipated court fil...

item.title: US: Trump Lawyer Met Russian Offering 'Political Synergy' - VOA News
item.description:
US: Trump Lawyer Met Russian Offering 'Political Synergy'  VOA News

President Donald Trump's former lawyer, Michael Cohen, was in touch as far back as 2015 with a Russian who offered "political synergy'' with the Trump election campaign, the federal special counsel said Friday in a court filing. Filings by prosecutors from both New York and the Trump-Russia special counsel's office laid out for the first time details of the cooperation of Cohen, a vital witness who once said he'd "take a bullet'' for the president but who in recent months has become a prime antagonist and pledged to come clean with the government. Federal prosecutors said Friday that Cohen ...

item.title: EU raises funds to fight 'disinformation war' with Russia - The Guardian
item.description:
EU raises funds to fight 'disinformation war' with Russia  The Guardian

The EU has launched a ‚Äúwar against disinformation‚Äù spread by the Kremlin in an attempt to protect next year‚Äôs European parliament elections. As new funding and measures were announced in Brussels, the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, was accused of spending more than ¬£1bn a year to ‚Äúspread lies‚Äù as part of a military strategy to cause division in Europe. ‚ÄúThere is strong evidence pointing to Russia as the primary source of disinformation in Europe,‚Äù said Andrus Ansip, vice-president of the European commission. ‚ÄúDisinformation is part of Russian military doctrine and its strategy to divide...

item.title: Putin warns of new arms race if US abandons nuclear missiles treaty - ABC News
item.description:
Putin warns of new arms race if US abandons nuclear missiles treaty  ABC News

Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned the United States that if it walks out of a key arms treaty and starts developing the type of missiles banned by it, Russia will do the same. Putin's remarks to Russian news agencies came a day after US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced at a NATO meeting that Washington will suspend its obligations under the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty (INF) in 60 days, citing Russian "cheating". The US has shared intelligence evidence with its NATO allies that it says shows Russia's new SSC-8 ground-fired cruise missile could give Moscow the a...

item.title: Feds Recommend Several Years in Prison for Michael Cohen - The Daily Beast
item.description:

Hector Retamal/AFP/Getty Federal prosecutors in New York recommended a ‚Äúsubstantial‚Äù prison term of several years for Michael Cohen, Donald Trump‚Äôs former fixer. But special counsel Robert Mueller‚Äôs office asked for no extra jail time in a separate case, citing his cooperation with investigators, including information Cohen provided about an offer of ‚Äúpolitical synergy‚Äù from Russia for the Trump campaign. In a memo filed late Friday afternoon, Mueller said Cohen had gone to ‚Äúsignificant lengths‚Äù to assist his probe into Russian interference in the 2016 election and possible collusion by the...

item.title: Russia‚Äôs global image slips, but seen gaining power - Financial Times
item.description:
Russia‚Äôs global image slips, but seen gaining power  Financial Times

Russia is seen as an increasingly powerful global player ‚Äî but a more disliked one ‚Äî an annual study has found. Vladimir Putin‚Äôs more aggressive foreign policy means 42 per cent of people polled across 25 countries by the Pew Research Center believe Russia plays a more important role in global affairs than a decade ago ‚Äî but just 26 per cent said they had confidence in Mr Putin to do the right thing. Over the past decade, Russia has fought a war with neighbouring Georgia, annexed Crimea and fuelled an insurgency in eastern Ukraine, entered the war in Syria to definitely tilt the conflict in...

Russian President Vladimir Putin opened the meeting of the Eurasian Economic Council Thursday by calling on the member states of the Eurasian Economic Union (EEU) to consider the idea of creating a common payment infrastructure. ‚ÄúWe suggest that the issue of creating common payment infrastructure using up-to-date financial technologies in EEU should be developed,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat would enhance sustainability of national payment systems of the EEU countries by making them less dependent on the dollar and other foreign currencies,‚Äù the Russian president explained. This means ‚Äúboosting economic...

item.title: Staying alive: world leaders who have had to prove they haven't died - The Guardian
item.description:
Staying alive: world leaders who have had to prove they haven't died  The Guardian

It is one of the stranger occupational hazards for world leaders: that at some point in their career they may have to deny reports of their own death. Just one day after the Nigerian president Muhammadu Buhari denied claims he had died and been replaced by a Sudanese impostor ‚Äúclone‚Äù, another world leader has been forced to address rumours of his demise. Ali Bongo, the president of Gabon, made his first appearance on Monday since falling ill nearly six weeks ago. Rumours of Bongo‚Äôs death have been widespread since he collapsed at a conference in Saudi Arabia on 24 October, with sources tell...

item.title: Russia laughs off US navy ship near its Pacific coast amid Black Sea tensions - The Telegraph
item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested that Russia would develop intermediate-range nuclear arms in response to the US exiting a key Soviet-era arms control agreement. ‚ÄúIt seems our American partners think ‚Ä¶ they should have such arms,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWhat will our response be? Simple. We‚Äôre going to do the same.‚Äù US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Tuesday that the US would suspend its obligations under the 1987 Intermediate-range Nuclear Forces (INF) treaty within 60 days over what it describes as Russian ‚Äúnon-compliance.‚Äù Speaking in Moscow on Wednesday, Mr Putin said that the US ha...

item.title: US military flexes muscles in message to Russia - CNN
item.description:
US military flexes muscles in message to Russia  CNN

The US military responded this week to what it calls Russia's "unlawful and destabilizing actions" in Ukraine and elsewhere by pushing back against Moscow on the seas and in the air. In the second US military operation in as many days, a US Air Force OC-135 observation aircraft conducted an "extraordinary flight" Thursday under the Open Skies Treaty "to reaffirm US commitment to Ukraine," the Pentagon said. The flight came the day after the US Navy had sailed the guided missile destroyer USS McCampbell near the Peter the Great Bay in the Sea of Japan, a move that irked Russia, which maintai...

item.title: Ukraine MPs Vote to Pull Out of Russia Friendship Treaty - VOA News
item.description:
Ukraine MPs Vote to Pull Out of Russia Friendship Treaty  VOA News

The Ukrainian parliament on Thursday voted to withdraw from a wide-ranging treaty on friendship with Russia, the latest step in escalating tensions between the two neighbors. The Supreme Rada overwhelmingly supported a motion by President Petro Poroshenko not to prolong the treaty when it comes up for renewal in April. The camouflage-clad president on Thursday visited an air base to announce an upcoming dispatch of troops to the Russian border. The long-simmering conflict between Russia and Ukraine that started with Russia's annexation of Crimea in 2014 spilled into the open on November 25 ...

item.title: Gorbachev praises Bush for political abilities, character - The Associated Press
item.description:
Gorbachev praises Bush for political abilities, character  The Associated Press

MOSCOW (AP) ‚Äî Former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev on Saturday expressed his "deep condolences" to the family of former U.S. President George H.W. Bush and all Americans following his death. Gorbachev worked closely with Bush to bring an end to the Cold War in the late 1980s and 1990s, and lauded the former president for his abilities as a politician and his personal character. "It was a time of great change," he told the Interfax news agency, "demanding great responsibility from everyone. The result was the end of the Cold War and nuclear arms race." Gorbachev said that he and his wife, ...

item.title: US planned to ditch INF in advance, now seeks reason why it should ‚Äì Putin on Pompeo ultimatum - RT
item.description:
US planned to ditch INF in advance, now seeks reason why it should ‚Äì Putin on Pompeo ultimatum  RT

The US has long planned to withdraw from the INF Treaty but it's only now that they started seeking justifications for it and conveniently pinned the blame on Russia, Vladimir Putin said after Washington‚Äôs 60-day ultimatum. Speaking to NATO foreign ministers on Tuesday, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has accused Russia of breaching the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty (INF). ‚ÄúIn light of these facts, today, America will announce it finds Russia in violation of the treaty and we will remove ourselves from the treaty in 60 days unless Russia returns to compliance,‚Äù Pompeo said. ‚ÄúMr Po...

item.title: Mohammed bin Salman: Saudi crown prince met with laughter and confrontations at G20 summit over Khashoggi murder - The Independent
item.description:
Mohammed bin Salman: Saudi crown prince met with laughter and confrontations at G20 summit over Khashoggi murder  The Independent

Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia exchanged laughs and clasped hands with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday in an incongruous moment of apparent celebration as they took their seats among world leaders gathered in Buenos Aires for an economic summit. It was the surest sign yet that the crown prince can still expect a warm welcome from at least some heads of state even after US intelligence agencies and many Western officials concluded he authorised the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, a Virginia resident and Washington Post columnist ambushed two months ago by Saudi agent...

item.title: Jim Carrey Has Special Request For 'Secret Santa' Robert Mueller In New Cartoon - HuffPost
item.description:
Jim Carrey Has Special Request For 'Secret Santa' Robert Mueller In New Cartoon  HuffPost

Jim Carrey wants just one thing from Robert Mueller this holiday season. In a new cartoon the actor-artist shared on Twitter on Wednesday, he depicted the special counsel, who is investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election and possible Trump campaign collusion, as a ‚ÄúSecret Santa.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou know what I want for Christmas,‚Äù Carrey captioned the image, which featured a child whispering the word ‚Äúindictments‚Äù into Mueller‚Äôs ear. Dear Mr. Mueller: Be my secret Santa. You know what I want for Christmas. pic.twitter.com/ipzWVTuRdW ‚Äî Jim Carrey (@JimCarrey) December 5, 2018 It‚Äôs the latest...

Vladimir Putin and Saudi Crown Prince jocular high-five  infobae

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro says on his way to Russia to meet with Putin - Reuters
item.description:
Venezuela's Maduro says on his way to Russia to meet with Putin  Reuters

Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro said late on Monday he was on his way to Russia to meet with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. Maduro wrote on his official Twitter page he was headed to an "important work meeting" with Putin. (Reporting by Gabrielle T√©trault-Farber; Editing by Darren Schuettler)

item.title: The Latest: Putin says if US builds missiles, so will Russia - The Associated Press
item.description:
The Latest: Putin says if US builds missiles, so will Russia  The Associated Press

MOSCOW (AP) ‚Äî The Latest on US-Russian confrontations over a key arms treaty (all times local): 2:50 p.m. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned the United States that if it walks out of a key arms treaty and starts developing the type of missiles banned by it, Russia will do the same. Putin's remarks to Russian news agencies on Wednesday came a day after U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced at a NATO meeting that Washington will suspend its obligations under the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty (INF) in 60 days, citing Russian "cheating." Russia has denied that it has...

item.title: What Bribery Experts Say About The Trump Organization's Plan To Give Putin A Penthouse - HuffPost
item.description:
What Bribery Experts Say About The Trump Organization's Plan To Give Putin A Penthouse  HuffPost

It‚Äôs not yet clear whether the shady-sounding plan of President Donald Trump‚Äôs company to give Russian President Vladimir Putin a $50 million penthouse during the 2016 election cycle meets the legal definition of a bribe ‚Äï or is even illegal ‚Äï experts tell HuffPost. The Trump Organization‚Äôs proposal to give Putin property in the planned Moscow Trump Tower ‚Äï an idea Trump‚Äôs personal lawyer Michael Cohen discussed with a Russian official, BuzzFeed reported ‚Äï has elements that appear to be problematic under a U.S. federal anti-bribery law called the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Under the FCP...

item.title: 'I am worried': Macron's chat with Saudi prince captured at G20 - The Guardian
item.description:
'I am worried': Macron's chat with Saudi prince captured at G20  The Guardian

The Saudi crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, suspected of ordering the murder of the dissident writer Jamal Khashoggi and accused of war crimes in the Yemen conflict, has told the French president, Emmanuel Macron, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry‚Äù at the G20 summit in Buenos Aires. The two leaders were having an informal conversation on the sidelines of the summit, standing close together and apparently unaware their conversation was being recorded. The subject of the snatched conversation was not immediately clear but a French presidential aide said afterwards that the Khashoggi murder and the Yemen conflict...

item.title: US Diplomat: Russia Should Release Ukrainian Sailors by Christmas - VOA News
item.description:
US Diplomat: Russia Should Release Ukrainian Sailors by Christmas  VOA News

U.S. Special Representative for Ukraine Kurt Volker says Russia needs to release the Ukrainian sailors taken captive in the Kerch Strait in late November by Christmas or "before the new year." Volker spoke with VOA on Monday in Washington, explaining that the United States and its Western allies are considering a number of options to prevent Russia from asserting any more "unilateral control" in the shared waters of the Azov Sea. WATCH: US Ukraine Envoy: Unified US, EU Response to Russia "We don't accept and will not accept Russia's claimed annexation of Crimea," he said, underlining the st...

item.title: A bro-shake with Putin, a talking-to from Macron: The Saudi prince‚Äôs less-than-royal treatment at the G20 - infobae
item.description:
A bro-shake with Putin, a talking-to from Macron: The Saudi prince‚Äôs less-than-royal treatment at the G20  infobae

The Saudi Crown Prince, Mohammed bin Salman, is in the middle of an international controversy. (Reuters) Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman was once feted in Western capitals as a new breed of economic and social reformer. Then came the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in Istanbul on Oct. 2 ‚Äì and with it, a whirlwind of international controversy and criticism that has engulfed the young Saudi royal. This week, less than two months after the killing of Khashoggi, Mohammed traveled to Buenos Aires for a G20 meeting that brought together leaders from the world's top economies. For the...

item.title: Kremlin: Putin Doesn't Feel Snubbed by Trump Canceling Talks - VOA News
item.description:
Kremlin: Putin Doesn't Feel Snubbed by Trump Canceling Talks  VOA News

The Kremlin says President Donald Trump's refusal to have a full-fledged meeting with President Vladimir Putin hasn't ruffled the Russian leader. The two leaders had been scheduled to have talks on the sidelines of last week's Group of 20 summit in Buenos Aires, but Trump abruptly canceled the encounter over the Russian seizure of three Ukrainian naval vessels and their crews. Putin's foreign affairs adviser, Yuri Ushakov, said the Russian leader didn't feel insulted, but added that the Kremlin regrets the cancellation in view of numerous issues that require discussion. He told reporters Tu...
